Posts.Content: Thanks helsbels18, where do you get if from?
Posts.Title: Hand Cream

Posts.Content: Hi everyone,   I am presently going through chemo for a third time in two years. I am on a clinical trial and taking capecitabin tablets. My hands have become very dry and he skin is starting to crack which looks rather unsightly but at present isn't painful. Can anyone suggest a good cream to use, I've previously been using garnier intensive repair but this doesn't seem to be having any effect now.  Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated.  Many thanks, Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Hand Cream

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn, Thank you very much for asking. I will do as you've said and hopefully be able to find the answers to my questions that are presently spinning around in my head. Glad your session went well/uneventful. Good luck with your mammogram.  Best wishes Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Local recurrence secondary breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn,  Thank you very much for your reply.  I think I may have written it wrong, I believe my consultant  said local recurrence and I've mistakenly put secondary in aswell.  I'm not sure that the chemo she was on about is totally new but it is new to my hospital so she was a little vague as to what it means.  I would be very grateful for any info you can get but please make sure you get yourself sorted first.  Good luck this afternoon hope all goes well.  Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Local recurrence secondary breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi everyone,  I was diagnosed with breast cancer March 2015. Had 8 rounds of chemo, 3 operations including mastectomy and 15 rounds of radiotherapy all completed Jan 2016.  Then in April 2016 I found a small lump on my breast bone which has unfortunately come back as cancer along with three more below my mastectomy scar. My CT Scan shows no further spread so that good news but on speaking with my consultant yesterday she wants to refer me to see a plastic surgeon within the same hospital trust to see if I'm eligible to have a new chemo drug that is administered to the sight of the cancer instead of through a cannula as I had last time (sorry can't remember the name of it) to see if the cancer which is apparently just in the skin not in any other tissue can be reduced before surgery to remove the affected area. Has anyone heard of, or had this type of treatment.  I will need to have skin removed from my back to replace the affected skin in the breast area and apparently this at present will need to be quite large to cover from my breast bone to the middle of my side and the distance from the top of where my breast would be to the bottom.  My consultant is positive that this can be cured but also said she wasn't surprised that my cancer had returned due to the microscopic particles that where present in my breast tissue that lead to the need for the mastectomy.  Hope you are all well.  Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Local recurrence secondary breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi grogg,  Definitely not what I wanted to here, was just staring to feel more like me again and hopeful I could return to work but it wasn't meant to be for the time being anyway.  Hope you are well. Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Another Lump Update

Posts.Content: Hi everyone,  Just need some advice please.  I finished my radiotherapy (15 sessions) last Wednesday and I have a meeting tomorrow with my manager at work and don't really know what to do. It's 10 months since I worked and she said before I got my results that if I'm working then I have to give 100%. In other words mistakes will not be tolerated. I work in a bank and understand this but I feel like I still have chemo brain if that's possible (finished chemo 26/8/15 8 cycles 2ec and 6 docetaxil) concentration is terrible and I'm tired, apart from that I'm doing ok. I have also had 3 operations the last one mastectomy 30/10/15 She has said I can do a phased return to work (hours etc not yet discussed) but she has said things in the past and then changed her mind. I feel like I'm being pressured into returning to work my sick note runs out 9/2/16.  Any advice and or questions to ask would be appreciated. Sorry if this is garbled it's how my brain works at the moment. Caz xXx
Posts.Title: Confused need some advice please

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone for your kind words.  Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Another Lump Update

Posts.Content: Hi everyone,  Just thought I'd update you all on the lump I found a couple of weeks ago.  I got my results yesterday and unfortunately it has been confirmed to be cancer again. I also had a small red area just under my mastectomy scar that my consultant is a little concerned about so she has taken a biopsy of this and is requesting a full body CT Scan which she said was a precaution.  My consultant has said with the information she has at the minute it will just be an operation to remove the lump which is apparently about the size of a grain of rice but she will know more once the CT Scan has been done and she has the results of the biopsy taken yesterday. Consultant has provisionally booked my op for 17th June so here I go playing the waiting game again. Hope you are all well.  Sending much love and hugs to you all.  Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Another Lump Update

Posts.Content: Thank you Julia  Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Another Lump Update

Posts.Content: Morning Elsie123, I am due to have another PICC Line inserted on Tuesday. My last one was removed last November.  Just like wombat.23 has said I always had my bp done on my lower arm and never over the PICC which I can imagine is quite painful.  With regard to showering I purchased a limbo adult elbow/PICC line cover which is waterproof and thankfully I didn't throw away so can use again this time. I also bought a PICC line cover as apposed to using the bandage the hospital supplied as like DianaC said the bandage rolled up and made it quite tight on the area it had rolled. Both I ordered from livebetterwith.com they are not too expensive approx £37 for both.  Hope this helps and all goes well for you.
Posts.Title: Blood pressure cuff and PICC line

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Hope you are all doing well.  I had a mx at the end of October and got my results yesterday. I am officially cancer free but still have to have radiotherapy for which I have my initial appointment next week. I am over the moon to say the least. Just thought I share this with you all.  I also wanted to ask my nails have tiger lines (as the hospital called them) which are quite rough. I would like to put nail varnish on but it shows all the ridges and looks horribl. Can I use a nail file especially for tops of nails to smooth them out or would I be doing more damage to them, my nails are also lifting from the top but seem to be growing out gradually. Any advice would be much appreciated. Thinking of you all on this terrible journey.  Caz xXx
Posts.Title: Good news for a change

Posts.Content: Morning ladies, Thank you I feel very blessed to have got this far. It is exactly 9 months today since I was originally diagnosed and I've suddenly realised how far I've come in this journey and say thank you daily that I'm here to see another day with my family and friends.  With regard to my nails I will try your suggestions and hope that they look better. hope you are all well, sending hugs to everyone. Caz xXx
Posts.Title: Good news for a change

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn,  Thank you for the info. Will copy to that group also.  Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Local Reacurrance

Posts.Content: Hi Helen,  Thank you for the info.  The info that I have re electrochemotherapy and bleomycin are: Bleomycin is an old type of chemo that was used many years ago but is very thick and heavy so in order for it to work they inject it to the site of the tumour and then zap the tumour with 8 prongs of electricity to open the tumour up and the chemo can then kill the tumour from the inside out. This is usually done with a local anaesthetic but as have numerous tumours they were giving me a general instead but hopefully it would have only needed one or two treatments and at my hospital anyway it is done by a plastic surgeon with consent from an oncologist.  Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Local Reacurrance

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn, Sounds a bit like my weekend, food shopping wise anyway. Had my grandson (he's 2) from Saturday to lunchtime today. Took my dad for CT Scan has a partially calapsed lung. Weather here has been gorgeous this last week or so just a few small showers today but still really warm.  Tomorrow I'm waiting for delivery (hubbies birthday Tuesday) and hopefully postman will bring date for my next trip to hospital too but if not I'll be ringing to find out what's happening.  My BCN is due back tomorrow so I'm assuming with the changes I've had while she has been away she will ring me in the next couple of days.  I'm feeling a lot more positive at the moment surprising what a few days can do.  Hope your fatigue is easing. Hugs.  Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Local Reacurrance

Posts.Content: Morning Carolyn,  No I've not seen it but think I may have to watch it when I rest later today.  My plan at the moment is to go to my oncology appointment tomorrow see what is said. But on speaking to my BCN this morning looks like chemo next week which was booked provisionally last week. Then hopefully if side effects allow I'm going to go back to work. I work in a bank so chemo brain is not allowed to show this time lol. It's strange the more I talk about it the more confident I'm becoming that I can cope with what's ahead. I may not beat it as in having it cured but I'm not going to let it dictate my life any more than it already has done. I will get my life back. 16 months since I've worked and I'm determined to go back even if it is part time rather than full time.  It must be extremely difficult having this disease and running your own business but it sounds like you have a fab partner taking some of the strain.  Hope you have a fab holiday where are you going? Hugs  Carole xXx

Posts.Title: Local Reacurrance

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn,  Yeah your right there. I'd get up to do something and before my bum had left the seat I'd forgotten what I was going to do.  I'm being treated at Leeds St. James's. They have a full building dedicated to cancer and even a hotel on the top floor for patients families (usually children's I think).  I will try take notes and see what they say but as far as I'm aware the chemo is two types carboplatin and paclitaxel which will be done weekly as apposed to three weekly as I had before. The ask a nurse seemed to think that this was the right drug to give for my situation it I'll find out more tomorrow.  Sounds like your holiday is at present a bit of a logistical nightmare but I'm sure it will be amazing when you get there. Think of the end result sun see and sangria and of course family.  Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Local Reacurrance

Posts.Content: Evening Carolyn, Got back from hospital about 7pm.  Saw the top oncologist at my hospital today and he has confirmed that an operation is out along with the electrochemotherapy and further radiotherapy. As suggested last week we are going with the weekly chemotherapy.  He said after an examination that it's a very aggressive form of breast cancer and the sooner we start the chemo the better. Could not give me a time line for how long this would be for but I'll now take it as it comes.  Due to me having serious thrush in my mouth last time and side effects from the two types of chemo both include thrust he will give me something to try and prevent it but if it's like last time it could possibly be constant as I had it for 11 days out of the 21 day cycle. So not really looking forward to that.  Loosing my hair won't be a problem as it hasn't grown back from last time (11 months today since my last chemo).  Have decided to pull on my big girl pants and just take it as it comes at the end of the day I'm still here and smiling How are you doing, has your fatigue got any better? Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Local Reacurrance

Posts.Content: Hi Jess,  Thank you will do both of your suggestions  Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Local Reacurrance

Posts.Content: Morning everyone,  I was suppose to have electrochemotherapy last Friday but unfortunately it was cancelled due to a national shortage of the drug bleomycin.  I went to see an oncologist yesterday and he said that they now may try a combination of paclitaxel and carboplatin which he is thinking of administering on a weekly basis as a control measure rather than a cure, but wanted to have a meeting with all the consultants and doctors that I've dealt with over the last couple of months so now have to wait for their decision until next week.  This all started with a tiny lump around the middle of April and has now increased to nine lumps that are growing and are all visible.  One of the consultants I saw about a month ago who was to perform the electrochemotherapy said he didn't think that an operation to remove the tumours and replace the skin from my back would heal properly due to previous radiotherapy (finished Jan 16) but prior to that my consultant who did the mastectomy didn't think this was a problem or at least didn't mention it.  I'm really struggling to come to terms with this information and don't know what to do any suggestions or help would be much appreciated.  Hope you are all well.  Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Local Reacurrance

Posts.Content: Hi Helen, Thank you for taking the time to reply.  I have copied my post onto the secondary breast cancer group as you suggested and will see what happens.  Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Local Reacurrance

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn, I had both within 19 days of each other. Then two weeks later was given the all clear. Five months later I notice a small lump which as I said above is now 9 tumours in three short months.  My surgery consultant said it was skin cancer and a local Reacurrance which as I understand it is because it's in the same area and that it was not as serious as what I'd already been through, therefore treatable. CT scan showed no further spread anywhere in my body.  I don't remember what if anything the oncologist said about it think I may have shut down when he said control not cure. The only thing I could think then was I'm going to die. Feeling very low at the moment as I don't know what to do.  Hope your injection goes well and thank you for looking at the leaflets. Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Local Reacurrance

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn,  Hope the fatigue doesn't last too long. I agree side effects should all be listed no matter how rare they are so that everybody knows what to possibly expect even though I know this probably isn't very practical  I had a reply from ask a nurse today and I'm feeling much better about everything. This is what she said: no you haven’t rambled. It sounds like the last 3 months have been really tough and I’m not surprised you feel like you’re losing the plot. It might be helpful to talk to your breast care nurse about what your hospital team are hoping to achieve with your treatment. Unfortunately breast cancer that has spread to the skin can’t be cured but can be controlled with treatment. Your oncologist has mentioned having a meeting and talking to your other consultants, this is called a Multidisciplinary team meeting (MDT) and allows the doctors to get together to discuss your condition and treatment options. Your surgeon is expert in surgery, your oncologist is expert in cancer treatments and the plastic surgeon is expert in electrochemotherapy. They need to get together and explore the potential benefits of each treatment. After they’ve done this, they’ll recommend the treatment that will be the most effective. Sometimes two treatments can be equally effective, in which case you’ll be involved in making the decision as to which treatment you’d prefer. It might be useful to talk through what’s happening, we’re available on our free helpline number 0808 808 0000 between 9am and 8pm from Monday to Friday. Best wishes, Karla (Macmillan Information Nurse Specialist). Best wishes Carole xXx
Posts.Title: Local Reacurrance

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn, Yeah I agree. The oncologist I saw I've never seen him before and the breast care nurse wasn't the one I normally deal with and she kept going back to the electrochemotherapy still being a possibility but as I've gone from 1 tumour to 9 in three months don't really want to think about how many there could be when the bleomycin is available again.  Each consultant or doctor I've seen has given me conflicting information, I understand that my situation changes each time but I would have thought that some of what's said would be the same.  Thank you for all your help it is very much appreciated.  Carole xXx

Posts.Title: Another Lump

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, It's not often I write on here but I do check in to see how people are daily.  Today I'm having a real meltdown I've found a small lump on my breastbone 0.3mm round it is approximately 10mm from my mastectomy scar. The mastectomy scar is not raised or painful whereas the lump is extremely painful to touch. My doctor has referred me back to the hospital as he doesn't know what it it but I'm not there until Wednesday next week. I'm so scared the cancer has come back. First time round it was ok let's do what needs to be done and I had a very positive attitude but know I'm struggling to cope.  Carole xXx
